title: Mackay Queensland father who repeatedly beat his daughter freed after less than a year in jail
text:
An abusive father who repeatedly beat his daughter has walked free from jail after spending less than a year behind bars.

The father-of-two from Mackay, Queensland, spent 297 days in custody after physically abusing his nine-year-old daughter over four months last year.

The man was convicted after he pulled his daughter off the ground by her ears, bit her until she bled and smacked her in the head because she was breathing too quickly.

A nine-year-old girl was physically abused by her father over four months last year, but he will walk free from jail after serving less than a year (file image)

He had pleaded guilty to eight offences including assault while armed, assault occasioning bodily harm and common assault.

In an impact statement to Mackay District Court on Monday, the girl's mother said that her father had left her daughter 'broken', The Courier-Mail reported.

'She wanted to die at the age of nine,' the woman said.

'This is something she is going to be fighting within herself for many many years.'

The mother said the girl had been left so traumatised that she flinched whenever she was touched.

On one occasion, the child waited until 7pm for her father to collect her from school before he slapped her across the face during the drive home.

She was also beaten with a belt and punched in the arms so hard that she couldn't sleep.

Crown Prosecutor Eddie Coker called for the man to be sentenced to three or four years in jail, telling the court the father had even shaved his daughter's head as a 'final indignity'.

The girl's mother said she had been left so traumatised that she flinched whenever she was touched (file image)

His crimes were first notified to police after the mother noticed she was covered in bruises.

Defence barrister Scott McLennan said the abuse was stemming from allegations the young girl had harmed her brother.

Mr McLennan said he had no 'real experience' in being a parent to two children but did love them.

Judge Brad Farr said the man had treated his child in 'hideous' ways.

'You have caused long term emotional and psychological harm to your child,' he said.

Judge Farr sentenced the man to two-and-a-half-years in prison, but he was granted immediate parole.
description: The father-of-two from Mackay, Queensland,  spent 297 days in custody after physically abusing his nine-year-old daughter over four months last year.
authors: Eliza Mcphee For Daily Mail Australia
